channel.title: Amplifier sound decreases
channel.description: When I use my amp for over a few minutes the volume decreases quite a bit, then after about half an hour it's on the same volume it'd be on at like half the theoretical value. This is only when it's turned up to 75%+ the maximum volume, but still, I'm sure this isn't right. Is there something wrong with my amp, or is this normal? All I know about amps is that a quiet input goes in and a loud output comes out, so sorry if this question is stupid.

item.title: Amplifier sound decreases
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:

have you considered it might be your ears getting used to the loud volume?
[/quote]

A+ troll will read again.[/quote]
a+ spam will ban etc

item.title: Amplifier sound decreases
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

What do you mean by the power supply? The cable?

I don’t understand why the problem remains even if the power supply has been taken out and put back in. I thought resetting fixed all electronics lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Amplifier sound decreases
item.dc:creator: @I_C_Y_Pure Love
item.description:
@I_C_Y_Pure wrote:

Have you considered changing the power-supply?
Even after resetting, if the power-supply is corrupted, and isn’t supplying enough power after ‘x’ amount of time, this could easily be the issue.

Other than that assumption, it sounds like a weird event.

Read full topic

item.title: Amplifier sound decreases
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Love, post:2, topic:319445”]What sort of input is being applied?
Is this being used in a car, or with a computer, etc.[/quote]

It’s a laptop, but I’m pretty sure it’s a problem with the amp because if I connect my philips speaker set up to it just after the amp ‘died’ it sounds normal. The amp then takes time to recover, and resetting the power supply has no effect.

Read full topic
